newsitem.title: USA: USDA to donate soybean meal to charity in Russia.
newsitem.headline: USDA to donate soybean meal to charity in Russia.

text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department said Thursday it will donate about 5,000 tonnes of soybean meal to a private charity for sale in Russia to raise money to provide loans to Siberian farmers.
USDA said the charity, the Citizens Network for Foreign Affairs Inc, will sign a contract for the sale of the soybean meal with a private grain trading company in Russia.
Proceeds from the sale will be used to provide loans to farmers in Siberia for equipment and operating expenses.
The donation was made under USDA's Food for Progress program. The supply period is fiscal year 1996.
